qas.question: The Notre Dame football team got a new head coach in 1918, who was it?
What was the amount of wins Knute Rockne attained at Notre Dame while head coach?
How many years was Knute Rockne head coach at Notre Dame?
How many national titles were won when Knute Rockne coached at Notre Dame?
In what year did the team lead by Knute Rockne win the Rose Bowl?

context: One of the main driving forces in the growth of the University was its football team, the Notre Dame Fighting Irish. <a0_0>Knute Rockne<a0_0/> became head coach in 1918. Under Rockne, the Irish would post a record of <a1_0>105<a1_0/> wins, 12 losses, and five ties. During his <a2_0>13<a2_0/> years the Irish won <a3_0>three<a3_0/> national championships, had five undefeated seasons, won the Rose Bowl in <a4_0>1925<a4_0/>, and produced players such as George Gipp and the "Four Horsemen". Knute Rockne has the highest winning percentage (.881) in NCAA Division I/FBS football history. Rockne's offenses employed the Notre Dame Box and his defenses ran a 7–2–2 scheme. The last game Rockne coached was on December 14, 1930 when he led a group of Notre Dame all-stars against the New York Giants in New York City.
